intro: Pilosella euchaetiiformis, commonly known as the woolly groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Pilosella euchaetiiformis is typically low-growing, with a mat-forming habit, and is adapted to arid environments. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience.
